meanings.definition: The action of restoring or renewing something.
meanings.sent1: The instauration of the old painting brought back its original beauty.
meanings.sent2: The instauration of the historic building preserved its grandeur for future generations.
meanings.sent3: The instauration of the old clock made it tick backwards for a day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the instauration of sunlight after a storm, bright and refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The instauration of the garden transformed it into a colorful paradise.

meanings.definition: The process of establishing something again.
meanings.sent1: After the fire, the instauration of the library was a community effort.
meanings.sent2: The instauration of the annual festival brought joy to the town once more.
meanings.sent3: The instauration of the old tradition involved dancing in the streets.
meanings.sent4: His speech was an instauration of hope in the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The instauration of peace in the region was a long-awaited relief.

meanings.definition: The act of instituting or introducing something new.
meanings.sent1: The instauration of the new policy caused excitement among the employees.
meanings.sent2: Her instauration of a book club at the school was a big hit.
meanings.sent3: The instauration of the silly hat day at work brought laughter to the office.
meanings.sent4: The instauration of the art exhibit was a burst of creativity in the town.
meanings.sent5: The instauration of the music program enriched the students' lives.
